title: Real-Time PPFG Interpretation
description: Pre-drill PPFG predictions are estimates. Real-time data reveals actual pressures, which may differ significantly. This module covers interpretation of pore pressure and fracture gradient indicators during drilling operations.
objectives: Understand PPFG data sources and their limitations
Interpret drilling parameters for pressure indications
Recognize pressure ramp zones and transition zones
Update operational decisions based on real-time PPFG

keyTopics.content: Pre-drill: seismic velocities, offset well data, basin models. While drilling: d-exponent, MWD/LWD resistivity and sonic, RFT/MDT measurements. Real-time interpretation calibrates pre-drill predictions.

Pore pressure increase often shows as: decreasing d-exponent (faster ROP for given WOB), increasing background gas, shale cavings character change, connection gas increases. These are warning signs before kicks.

Resistivity decreases in overpressured shales (higher water content). Sonic slowness increases (undercompaction). These trends, combined with drilling indicators, give confidence in pressure estimates.
Pore pressure doesn't always increase gradually. Centroid effects, fault blocks, and aquifer connections can cause sudden pressure increases. Recognize the signs and anticipate - don't be surprised.
Pre-drill FG is estimated from stress models. Real FG is confirmed by LOT/FIT. In HPHT, FG may be lower than predicted due to temperature effects. Don't rely on predictions alone - test.
When real PPFG differs from predicted, mud weights and casing points may need adjustment. This requires communication between rig, office, and geology team. Have decision-making protocols in place.

referenceWellContext.ppfgProfile: Significant pressure ramp from 3,500m through TD
concerns: Pressure increase from 13.2 to 17.2 ppg EMW in lower sections
Tight window at TD requires accurate PPFG
Casing points may need adjustment based on real-time data
Early detection of pressure ramp is critical

operationalPrinciples: Pre-drill PPFG is a starting point, not gospel
Multiple indicators give confidence - one indicator is a warning
Anticipate pressure changes - don't just react
LOT/FIT confirms fracture gradient - trust tests over predictions
Communicate PPFG changes to decision-makers immediately
